title: 104_hr1049
content: Young American Workers' Bill of Rights - Amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to revise and increase requirements relating to child labor standards, including: (1) reporting, recordkeeping, and certification, (2) orders and regulations, (3) penalties, (4) coverage regardless of sales volume, (5) civil actions. And (6) migrant or seasonal agricultural labor. Directs the Secretary of Labor to: (1) compile annual data relating to child labor. (2) provide for coordination among enforcement personnel for Federal and State labor standards, occupational health and safety laws, and Federal immigration laws, (3) establish an Advisory Committee for Child Labor, and (4) publicize violators of child labor laws. Authorizes appropriations.
